intro: Ruelliopsis setosa, commonly known as the hairy ruelliopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, with hairy stems and leaves that give it its common name. Ruelliopsis setosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for pollinators.
